newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan cotton rates plunge on mills' cash crunch.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan cotton rates plunge on mills' cash crunch.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates fell sharply on Wednesday because textile mills were short of cash, dealers at the private Karachi Cotton Association said.
Rates dropped after mills began buying cotton on one-month credit, dealer Oveis Razzak said. Some dealers were charging 100 to 125 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) above the spot rates.

Some exporters had started buying low-quality cotton to fulfill their commitments, he said. In the kerb market, NIAB-78 variety was quoted at 1,950/2,050 rupees per maund, K-68 at 2,300/2,375 and MNH-93 at 2,325/2,375.
